# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a function `add_yearmonth` that you can use to add the new column. This function uses the built-in `Year` and `Month` functions from DataFrames.jl:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = map((dt)-> DateFormat("y")(dt) * DateFormat("m")(dt), df[:dt])
end
```

You can use the `add_yearmonth` function on your DataFrame like this:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to your DataFrame `df`. The values of this new column are the year and month of each date in string format “yyyymm”.
